nodes.text: Avenger of Jakku was a pseudonym used by a collector of Imperial artifacts following the fall of the Galactic Empire. By 28 ABY, fellow Imperial artifact enthusiast Senator Ransolm Casterfo had encountered Avenger of Jakku, but considered the collector's moniker ridiculous despite suspecting that it was probably only role-play of a part the collector might play in a reenactment.
Avenger of Jakku was first mentioned in the novel Bloodline, which was written by Claudia Gray and released in 2016.
